meanings.definition: An example that refutes or disproves a proposition or theory.
meanings.sent1: She provided a counterexample to show that the theory was incorrect.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use counterexamples to test the validity of their hypotheses.
meanings.sent3: The counterexample she shared at the meeting had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His counterexample was like a bright light shining on a dark idea.
meanings.sent5: The counterexample stood out in my mind like a colorful painting in a gray room.

meanings.definition: Instances that contradict a general statement or rule.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a counterexample to demonstrate the exception to the rule.
meanings.sent2: In mathematics, counterexamples help students understand when a rule does not apply.
meanings.sent3: The counterexample in the story made the plot more interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her counterexample was a sharp contrast to the usual pattern.
meanings.sent5: The counterexample was like a puzzle piece that didn't fit the rest of the picture.
